entry.title: Scanned start-up venture: Hive AI
entry.summary: A distributed data-labelling tech-startup founded in 2013 at San Francisco, US.
entry.content:
Company
What they do Patented distributed data-labelling tech with variety of data and computer-vision (CV) models
Founded 2013
Funding US$50M+
Team size 150-ish
HQ San Francisco, USA
Branch Gurgaon, Haryana, India
Links Website / LinkedIn / Twitter
Founder Dmitriy Karpman & Kevin Guo (2019 Forbes 30 under 30)
[our contact: Simon Lebsekal, Enterprise Associate]
Profile Stanford graduates and ex-Google, funded by Peter Thiel (Founders Fund), General Catalyst, and 8VC.

Competence

  • AI-as-a-Service like platform solving challenges (object detection, facial recognition, transcription, etc.) for clients

  • They have a machine learning data labeling solution. In that 2-sided marketplace, over a million distributed workers generate labelled CV data sets for applications around, ADAS, Autonomous, robotics Visual validation etc.

  • They also have solution (visual intelligence models) for identification of visual information. They allow their APIs if we are interested to incorporate their models into our workflows. On-device deployment via SDK is another option.

  • Their last product is television advert analytics. They call it Hive Media and claim that it’s dataset is world’s largest!

What they're doing today

Possible value they create

  1. ADAS applications: Delivering India specific solutions at affordable cost by leveraging on their capabilities

  2. Insurance: Prompt damage classification, enable quick + accurate claim processing by MI (enhanced customer UX)

  3. Marketing : Improve our competitive intelligence via their AI powered advert analytics technology MENSIO

  4. Document digitization: Via their AI empowered OCR tech, we can cut manual error while digitizing old printed data

entry.title: Scanned start-up venture: SkyTree
entry.summary: A tech-startup having patented air purification technology to remove CO2, Moisture.
entry.content:
Company
What they do patented air purification technology to remove CO2, Moisture
Founded 2014
Funding US$0.5M+
Team size 10-ish
HQ Science Park 408, Amsterdam, Netherlands, Europe
Branch NA
Links Website / LinkedIn / Twitter
Founder Max Beaumont
[our contact: Shubham Sandeep, Chief Commercial Officer]
Profile Entrepreneurs (spinout of the European Space Agency), and system engineers

Competence

  • Their CO2 re-capture process was originally developed by ESA to make longer space missions possible by extracting the CO2 exhaled by astronauts on board of spacecraft

  • They built a design to remove CO2 and H2O continuously for up to 4 passengers and keep the CO2 concentration and Relative-Humidity constant over prolonged periods of time.

  • This technology reduces the need for this by ensuring that CO2 levels are maintained at an optimum level which enables the re-circulation of indoor air without bringing in outside air thereby reducing the load on HVAC systems

Their Design

Skytree Twin Module (prototype) consists of two 2L cartridges each equipped with a fan and a heater in the inlet module. The outlet module consists of two flaps which are being automatically controlled allowing for change in air flow direction depending on the mode (adsorption or desorption). The system is designed to remove CO2 continuously.
